alert.note: Alert for King (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 8:19AM PST until March 01 at 5:30PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Tolt River Above Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. .A strong storm is coming in to western Washington with multiple factors that will produce high runoff and flooding. Heavy, prolonged rainfall will be coupled with some snow snow melt in low to mid elevations of the mountains from rising snow levels and strong warm and moist winds. This will drive some rivers above minor to major flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tolt River Above Carnation. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5000.0 cfs, the Tolt River will flood Tolt River Rd NE and many driveways. Some homes in the San Souci area could be inaccessible due to deep and quick flood waters. This river level on the Tolt corresponds to a phase 3 flood in the King County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM PST Monday the flow was 2420.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 7660 cfs late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood flow is 5000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7630.0 cfs on 01/09/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 415 PM PST.
